oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Milcherzeugung und Soziale Arbeit - Arbeitsplätze für Menschen mit Behinderung in ökologisch wirtschaftenden Milchviehbetrieben
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Meidlinger, Shadée
van Elsen, Dr. Thomas
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Community development
Animal husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The concepts of care farms that offer perspectives for people with handicaps differ in many ways. In this investigation four organic dairy farms providing jobs for handicapped men were visited. The results of the interviews with the stakeholders carried out on the farms are presented. A special focus is given to the relationship with the attending supervisor and the importance of cows and cattle for individual development. The outcomes give an insight into the daily routine farm work, the possibilities dairy and care farms offer to their clients, but also the difficulties and limits of integration.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Meidlinger, Shadée and van Elsen, Dr. Thomas (2009) Milcherzeugung und Soziale Arbeit - Arbeitsplätze für Menschen mit Behinderung in ökologisch wirtschaftenden Milchviehbetrieben. Poster at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
